Designing in Context (A): Territories, Clients and Audiences

In this module, students will understand the intersection of narrative, language, and userexperience. Exploring ‘context’ further will introduce the nuances of audience needs and theimportance of communication environments. The central theme is context-drivencommunication design, highlighting the need to adapt creative choices to the client andmaking meaningful connections between visual language, copy, narrative, and the finalconveyed message.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Research and understand narrative, language, and user experience in communication design.

+  Evidence pitching skills to effectively present design concepts.

+  Proficiently communicate a message and meaning.

+  Apply strategic frameworks to real-world scenarios to develop practical solutions.
